item.title: Patterns in Black Lives Matter Manifesto
item.description: SUMMARY: The Black Lives Matter Global Network believes that “state-sanctioned violence and anti-Black racism” is the political problem in America today, and repeated it twice. Black Lives Matter sounds like an obvious true slogan, but it also the name of a political group. I recommend you search the internet for “black lives matter” “what we believe” At the top, you will find a manifesto, a declaration of the intentions and views political organization.

item.title: Patterns in Trump's 2020 State of the Union Address
item.description: Trump just delivered an excellent State of the Union speech. Here’s the plain text of the report. Let’s mine for patterns for in the text. Here is a sample of the most repeated phrases. without any preprocessing. This is output of the free website megapatterns.com Below are handpicked phrases that catch my eye as representative of style and content. Count Phrase 88 we 34 will 29 American 29 I 24 Americans 24 people 24 us 18 America 11 the Congress 7 Tonight, 7 our country 5 the United States 3 the last year 2 , California, 4 asking the Congress to 3 we are going to 2 American workers and American 2 tonight, I am 2 have ended the war on 3 I am asking the Congress to This speech is about “we” and “will”.

item.title: Patterns in the Mueller Report
item.description: Let’s find the repeated phrases in the Mueller Report. Here’s the plain text of the report. It is 442 pages. Here’s a PDF of the of output MegaPatterns.com without any preprocessing. There is lots of noise, like long sequences of periods. But browsing the lightly processed patterns, I see strong signals. This phrase is repeated 6 times in the Mueller Report: that it could assist the Campaign through the anonymous release of information There is no evidence discovered that anonymous releases occurred.

item.title: Patterns in Chess
item.description: Yeah Buddy!!! Happy Thanksgiving!!! Let’s find the repeated sequences of moves in chess matches between chess masters. The source of the chess moves is here: https://github.com/rozim/ChessData/tree/master/ChessOk.com Stat Type Number # of matches 469,825 # of moves 19,031,726 runtime of analysis 62 minutes 23 seconds Portable Game Notation (PGN) is a plain text format for recording chess games. I’m running on a 2013 MacBook with Intel i5 2.6Ghz CPU. I will re-run analysis on a more current Lenovo X1 with Intel i7 1.

item.title: Patterns in Words
item.description: Let’s find the repeated phrases in the English words. The words come from https://github.com/dwyl/english-words/blob/master/words_alpha.txt. The words list looks like this: ... aardvark aardvarks aardwolf ... To dig into the letters, I separate the letters by a space and insert a comma after the end of the words. ... a a r d v a r k, a a r d v a r k s, a a r d w o l f, .

item.title: Patterns in Shakespeare
item.description: Let’s find the repeated phrases in the works of William Shakespeare. The text is available here: [The Complete Works of William Shakespeare] (http://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/100) What’s convenient for us is that all the works are combined into a single text file. First, let’s look at the longest repeats, it is repeated once. [Reads] 'When as a lion's whelp shall, to himself unknown, without seeking find, and be embrac'd by a piece of tender air; and when from a stately cedar shall be lopp'd branches which, being dead many years, shall after revive, be jointed to the old stock, and freshly grow ; then shall Posthumus end his miseries, Britain be fortunate and flourish in peace and plenty.

item.title: Patterns in the Tweets of Donald Trump
item.description: Let’s find the repeated phrases in the 34,633 tweets from Donald Trump. The text is available here, and updated daily: [Donald’s Tweets] (http://www.trumptwitterarchive.com/) This is the longest repeated phrase and is repeated once: Make America Great Again! https : I am counting on your help to defeat Hillary Clinton and her cronies. Let's Make America Great Again! https: As President, I WILL fix this rigged system and only answer to YOU, the American people!

item.title: Patterns in the Koran
item.description: Let’s find the repeated phrases in The Koran (Al-Qur’an). The text is available here: [Koran] (http://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/2800) The Koran is organized into chapters, called Surahs. There are 114 Surahs in the Koran, each divided into verses. In this Surah 49, the Moon, we find this longest repeated phrase. It is a little spooky: And how great was my vengeance and my menace! Easy for warning have we made the Koran - but, is there anyone who receives the warning?

item.title: Patterns in the Bible
item.description: Let’s find the repeated phrases in the bible. The text is available here: [The King James Version of the Bible] (http://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/10) First let’s look at the longest repeats, it is repeated once. In the Hebrew Bible or Old Testament, we find this long phrase that says that Hezekiah’s house was fancy. The Second Book of the Kings 20:13 And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and shewed them all the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not.
